The new law will make it easier for
child abusers who have taken women’s rights from them through the Scottish Parliament! 

Scotland has made it very easy for sex pests, perverts and paedophiles to operate and there will be consequences. We need to protect the women and children of Scotland 

The majority of people in Scotland do not want these new rules and wish for our women and child to be safe.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for the Scottish Parliament.

attributes.action: Take action now to reduce UK emissions by 50% by 2030 to avoid climate disaster
attributes.background: The UN is warning that unless emissions are cut in half by 2030 there will be a climate catastrophe. Follow UK Committee on Climate Change recommendations. Do not grant new fossil fuel licenses, invest in green technology including energy storage and reintroduce green incentives.
attributes.additional_details: I cannot sit idly by and watch the lack of focus on climate issues. There are daily reminders of the issues climate change is already causing and we are perilously close to some critical tipping points. I want my daughter to have a future. One where we are working to restore the world and not to continue with a growth at any cost mentality.

rejection.details:
The Government is already working towards its commitment to reduce emissions in 2030 by at least 68% compared to 1990 levels.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

End All Government Subsidies for Fossil Fuel Companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621583

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

attributes.action: Resolve the energy crisis through Green energy not by fracking or oil and gas
attributes.background: Resolve the energy crisis by investing in green energy; green energy comes on stream about as quickly as new oil and gas or fracking but doesn't harm the environment. It is also sustainable and lower cost. End the exploration of new oil and gas fields and fracking and back green energy instead.
attributes.additional_details:
Resolving our energy crisis by extracting every last drop of oil, every last whiff of gas, and by fracking will contribute to global warming. Global warming is already causing widespread problems, it would be selfish to contribute further to those.
There is no advantage to turning to oil and gas, for instance offshore wind farms can be built in about the same timescale (and in some cases faster) than new oil and gas. Green energy (on or offshore) will reduce energy prices and help the climate.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Decommission all fossil fuel power stations by 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620604

attributes.action: Spend a day without using fossil fuels to prevent climate change
attributes.background: To stop fossil fuel usage in the UK for 1 day every 2 weeks. Fossil fuels are one of the major things contributing to climate change, using these produce greenhouse gases, methane, carbon dioxide and water vapour, increasing their amounts in the atmosphere, making it harder for heat energy to leave.
attributes.additional_details: To help stop climate change and reduce the amount of fossil fuels we release into the atmosphere. To save our planet, including all the animals and nature which are struggling to survive because of humanity. We can do this by walking, or bike-riding to places instead of driving, using less energy at home, eating more plant based products, throwing away less food, stopping factory productions that produce greenhouse gases, forcing them to go green and recycling, reusing and repairing more often.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the use of fossil fuels, but it's not clear exactly what action you want the Government to take. It's not clear if you want the Government to ban the use of all fossil fuels, and fossil fuel-derived products, for one day a fortnight, or do something different.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Review recent energy strategy to make planning for onshore wind turbines easier
attributes.background: There is an energy crisis and climate emergency now. Onshore wind turbines are cheap, effective and quick to install. Onshore wind linked with Hydrogen storage would be a good way to provide clean green renewable energy 100% of the time quicker than the governments proposed strategy.
attributes.additional_details: Debate the planning legislation with regard to onshore wind to put it on a par with a war footing due to the urgent nature and vulnerability of the climate emergency and energy crisis. Consider permitted development on existing wind turbine sites to permit a blade tip height of 119m. Similarly, planning legislation with regards to wayleaves, easements for   infrastructure and grid connections  with a view to streamline and simplify planning and connections for onshore wind.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Scale/speed up renewable energy to reduce carbon/costs and increase security
attributes.background: Increase the roll-out of UK renewables, specifically Solar, Wind, Tidal and Green Hydrogen, in order to reduce our reliance on fossil fuels for electricity generation. Also, increase research into increasing available storage capacity for renewable energy. Increase the FIT to encourage PV panels.
attributes.additional_details: In October 2021, Sky News reported that over half of the UK's electricity was produced from natural gas. We are currently on course for a global temperature rise in the next century with devastating consequences. A proportion of UK gas supply comes from Russia, who at the time of writing are on the brink of invading Ukraine. It is imperative that UK takes control of it's own electricity supply from renewable sources which unlike fossil fuels cannot be laid claim to by a particular nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Protect productive agricultural land and green belt from development in law

Green spaces provide a home for biodiversity to thrive also part of the solution to the Climate Crisis. They are also vital for people's health and well being.

attributes.action: Stop dangerous pollution from poultry farms along the Wye and its tributaries.
attributes.background: Intensive poultry units (IPUs) along the River Wye and its tributaries are turning it into a wildlife deathtrap and causing untold damage to one of Britain’s best loved rivers. Runoff from IPUs causes the spread of algal blooms that devastate the river’s ecosystem and turn the water a murky green.
attributes.additional_details: Take long-term strategic action to ensure that the UK poultry industry is environmentally sound, through effective delivery of the Environment Act, Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, the Well-Being of Future Generations Act and the Water Framework Directive. Conduct urgent research, regulate and monitor IPUs and enforce LPA planning conditions. Regulate the poultry industry and hold it to account for breach of environmental responsibility. Publish public reports on progress.

rejection.details:
Your petition appears to relate to activities in Wales, and planning and the environment are devolved matters, so the responsibility of the Welsh Government, Welsh local authorities and Natural Resources Wales, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition the Welsh Parliament here: https://petitions.senedd.wales/

attributes.additional_details: Everyone appreciates clean green outdoor spaces, no one wants to see rubbish on the beaches. It's inexcusable. Environment impact. Now is the time to change bad habits.

attributes.action: Prevent Covid19 being used as an excuse to cease child contact.
attributes.background: We would like the Family Court to clarify its guidance on non-compliance with child arrangement orders during Covid-19.  This would prevent the guidance being used cynically by one parent as justification for stopping the child seeing their other parent.
attributes.additional_details: The President of the Family Court issued guidance on how child arrangements orders should be complied with during lockdown.  It says a parent may exercise parental rights and stop a child from seeing the other parent.  This guidance can be interpreted as a green light for  one parent to alienate the other parent from the child’s life and face little prospect of legal consequence if they claim they are acting on genuine health concerns.  It is also silent on how to deal with parents shielding.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons are responsible for.

Child Arrangement Orders are a matter for parents and the courts, and not the Government or House of Commons.

If you believe someone has failed to keep to a Child Arrangements Order you can apply for this to be enforced. Guidance on how to do this is available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/enforcing-a-child-arrangements-order-cb5

attributes.action: Keep UK Golf Courses Open
attributes.background: Keep golf courses in the UK open, with social distancing measures in place. If the public are still allowed to walk around parks, forests and beaches, golf should be able to continue with responsible boundaries and rules implemented.
attributes.additional_details: Measures could include shallow holes to pick ball out without touching the hole, no touching the flags/leaving them in on all greens, no rakes in bunkers, 20 minutes between tee times, 1 group at any time on the tee box, 1balls only or 2balls if they live in the same house.

attributes.action: Stop the misrepresentation of 'high' protein content in food
attributes.background: Enforce stricter standards on the branding of foods said to contain high protein.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies sometimes market food as 'high in protein content'. However, these foods often contain a similar amount to their non-protein-branded equivalents. 

This is health-washing (the green-washing equivalent); consumers are being mis-sold food that is undeservedly branded as protein-rich.  

Consider setting a standard on food branding/marketing to ensure protein marketed foods are not misleading consumers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/eur/2006/1924/annex/division/17/adopted

attributes.action: Put South Africa on the Green list for travel
attributes.background:
South Africa has been on the red list for months whilst other countries with higher cases per 100k, lower vaccine rates, more variants and less restrictions remain on green and amber. 
There is no scientific data that justifies the restrictions in place for those returning from South Africa.
attributes.additional_details:
There are around 250, 000 South Africans living in the United Kingdom. Many South Africans living in the UK, as well as non-South Africans are desperate to visit loved ones living there, or are already in the vicious cycle of holidays booked prior to Covid.
Not only does South Africa being on the red list mean that people are unable to afford the extortionate cost of hotel quarantine, but many are haemorrhaging money as a result of constant re-booking that they are unable to get out of.

rejection.details:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-system-for-international-travel

Remove South Africa from the travel 'Red List'

attributes.action: Education staff want Gavin Williamson’s resignation.

attributes.action: Recognise access to green space as a human right
attributes.background: Green spaces – with the mental and physical health benefits they provide – should be easily accessible for everyone. But this is not currently the case. 2.7M UK residents live over half a mile from a green space, with low-income and BAME communities most likely to suffer a deficit of local greenery.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government must declare access to green space a human right and take action to fulfil this right. This means protecting existing urban nature and increasing the volume of greenery in the areas where it is most needed (with pocket parks, street trees and biophilic architecture). 

COVID-19 has both awakened the nation’s appreciation for green spaces and exposed its stark disparities in access to them. We now have a chance to shape a healthier, happier and more equal society – let’s seize it.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like access to green space to be a human right, but we're not sure how you would like the Government to implement this. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as requiring planning laws to include a minimum amount of green space based on population.

attributes.action: Stop the reopening of the Stoke to Leek railway line.
attributes.background: We would like the government to block the reopening of this line that has been disused for 32 years.
attributes.additional_details:

There are safety concerns for local school children going to and from school and also playing on the line and causing a danger to road users by dropping stones onto the road below bridges as has before.
It needs to stay as a green space.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Increase Environmental Protection and Green Focus in Covid-19 Recovery Plan
attributes.background: The government must enforce stronger environmental protection within plans for Covid-19 recovery. It must implement a green focus and invest in active travel, energy efficiency, renewable energy, nature tourism, wildlife and environmental conservation, and other green projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite declaring a climate emergency in 2019 the UK Covid-19 recovery plan has an overly strong focus on construction and development at the expense of protecting the natural environment.
Polls show a public preference for a change to the economy and a greener focus, which was promised but quickly forgotten. 
The UK has failed to meet the majority of climate action targets. 
It is our responsibility to protect the natural environment, especially after it has provided us with so many benefits.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: The Crown Estate to forego any income from renewable energy projects in the UK.
attributes.background: The British monarch receives 25% of all profits from the Crown Estate. With the expanding renewable energy sector, mainly offshore wind farms, the monarch will receive a windfall of 10's of millions of pounds from green energy license sales. This money should be used to fund green energy projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Offshore Wind Sector Deal
The government will work collaboratively with the sector and wider stakeholders to ensure that up to 30GW of offshore wind can be delivered by 2030.

The Crown Estate and Crown Estate Scotland will undertake new seabed leasing in 2019, ensuring a sustainable pipeline of new projects for the late 2020s and early 2030s. 

www.gov.uk/government/publications/offshore-wind-sector-deal/offshore-wind-sector-deal

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Crown Estate's income, including from offshore wind, is returned to the Treasury.  The Sovereign Grant is calcualted as 25% of the income from two years previously. We're not sure whether you want to reduce the size of the Sovereign Grant or stop the collection of any income.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles in the manufacture of soft drinks for UK market

attributes.action: Do more to help face the rising costs of living.
attributes.background: The people of Britain want the government to do more to help face the ridiculous rise in the cost of living. E.g. Green energy sources to bring the energy prices down, reduce the energy cap, reduce the fuel tax, reduce VAT. Increase minimum wage further.
attributes.additional_details: People cannot afford to pay 54% more for their energy, ontop of the increase in fuel, rent, council tax, water, phones and worst of all food.  The people of Britain should not be put in a position where they must chose between their heating and their food. People can't afford to fill their cars to get to and from work. We understand you're concerned about the cost of living, however it's not clear what action you want the Government to take regarding 'green energy sources'. Further, the level of the energy price cap is set by Ofgem, the independent regulator for energy markets, not the UK Government.

attributes.action: Introduce a new Smart Export Guarantee (SEG) rate option to combat fuel poverty.
attributes.background: Under the SEG, excess energy is usually bought very cheaply by energy providers. This needs to change to help combat fuel poverty. Under the SEG producers should be able to state that they want excess energy to be available to those in fuel poverty rather than resold by energy companies at a profit.
attributes.additional_details: Excess energy from home generators is usually bought by energy providers at very low rates via the SEG, (~5p/kWh) and resold back by them at much higher rates, (~35p/kWh). This needs to change for various reasons. Primarily to support those in, or threatened with fuel poverty. Therefore, The Government and Ofgem should work to introduce an option. Morally and socially we should all be helping to provide a green and independent energy supply for the UK and help alleviate fuel poverty.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

We understand that you're concerned about fuel poverty and the practices of energy companies. However, giving people an option to divert the energy they generate to households in fuel poverty would be an operational matter for energy suppliers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Review traffic signal colours to ensure they meet needs of the colour-blind
attributes.background: The Government should review the traffic signal colours, the highway code and signal standards to ensure meet the needs of the colour-blind. Traffic signals have used red for stop, red and amber to prepare, green to proceed if safe to do so, and amber to stop unless unsafe to stop.
attributes.additional_details: 8.3% of males and 0.5% of females have some sort of colour-blindness. The most common form - deuteranomaly - is red-green colour blindness, which can render two of the three colours on traffic signals less visible. Red appears as a dark-yellow which is more difficult to see than the amber signal which may result in drivers of vehicles not seeing stop signals. This is surely unsafe for all road users - including pedestrians - and makes such drivers more vulnerable to committing driving offences.

attributes.action: Build More Children Play Equipment and Fitness Equipment in Green Spaces/Parks
attributes.background: The government have closed gyms and soft play and encouraged outdoor exercise but there has been no government facilitation. As a result play parks and the very limited amount of outdoor fitness equipment have became very widely used, counter productive to the entire concept of social distancing.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should actively build play parks and fitness equipment on all green spaces e.g. local parks in the cities. Each city council should place and maintain hand sanitisation stations in these areas.

Outdoor fitness equipment should also be provided particularly for teenagers and students in mind. e.g. pull up, parallel and monkey bars. Outdoor bouldering (similar to Cunningar Loop/Fairlop bouldering parks in Glasgow/London) and kayaking should also be facilitated on lochs/lakes.

rejection.details:
Local amenities, including play equipment and fitness equipment, are the responsibility of individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding to local authorities, for the purpose of increasing the amount of play equipment and fitness equipment in their localities.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of disposable BBQ's.
attributes.background: I would like to have these items removed from sale and have using them in a public place made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's are responsible for many fires in the UK, in our local and national parks and areas of natural beauty.
